description.narrative: Addressing Climate Change Risks on Water Resources and Food Security in the Dry Zone of Myanmar

activity-description.narrative: Addressing climate risk resilience through community based and community driven adaptation in decentralized settings for the people in Magwe.
Addressing climate risk resilience through community based and community driven adaptation in decentralized settings in Mandalay.
Addressing climate risk resilience through community based and community driven adaptation in decentralized settings in Sagaing .

comment.narrative: - 70 small scale water pumping systems installed - 56 communal water tanks installed - 20 shallow tube well and 12 deep tube well renovated or constructed - 60 communal ponds rehabilitated or constructed - 304 ha of land covered with soil and water conservation measures - 1,086 Ha of micro-watersheds protected through natural forest conservation, community forest establishment and public land tree planting activities - Community-based agro-forestry plots established on 1,477 hectares of private and communal lands to conserve soil and water - 4,665 HH are trained on climate-resilient farming methods - 127 thresher user groups are trained on resilient post-harvest processing and 36 elevated storage system installed in order to reduce climate-induce post-harvest losses - 1400 HH received climate resilient livestock production training - 1800 HH has increased diversity of livestock assets -Climate profiles and hazard maps (floods, earthquake and drought) for 5 townships updated and distributed to local government and related departments - 75 community based disaster risk management (CBDRM) team are formed to relay climate related early waring information - 75 village disaster management plan formulated to reduce risk and prepare communities during extreme events - 5 Climate risk information sub-committees established in targeted townships for effective communication of climate risk and early warning information - 5 ago-advisories per township/month issued to provide early warning to farmers and adapt to extreme weather events - Exit strategy and sustainability strategy/plan, including handover of activities for all project components prepared and implemented

- 70 small scale water pumping systems were installed in 26 villages of Shwebo Township. The project also provided operations and maintenance training for pumping system; 56 communal water tanks were constructed in 5 project townships and community use it to collect rain water from the roof top of nearby buildings or from the deep tube wells; 20 shallow tube wells were constructed in Shwebo and Monywa Township. The project also constructed 9 new deep tube wells and renovated 3 deep tube wells; the project renovated 60 communal ponds in 5 the project townships. The project also constructed a new earthen pond in Myingyan Township; The project has treated 777 hectares of land with various soil conservation measures; The project has protected 1,342 ha of land through natural forest conservation, community forest establishment and public land tree planting activities in 5 project townships; The project has established 1,329 ha of community based agro-forestry plots in 5 project townships. This is a little less than 2018 target (1477 ha) because the target for farm boundary plantation have been moved to public land plantation; 10,691 HH were trained on climate-resilient farming methods; 127 thresher user groups have been trained on resilient post-harvest processing and 36 elevated storage systems were installed in order to reduce climate-induce post-harvest losses; 2,028 HHs (2,028 participants) received climate- resilient livestock production training in the 5 project townships; 2,309 HHs have received livestock species (goats, pigs, chicken) in the 5 project townships; Climate profiles for 5 townships prepared in both English and Myanmar languages and circulated to local government and related departments; 75 CBDRM teams were formed in 75 pilot villages and trainings provided on DRR and early warning; 75 village disaster management plans formulated and submitted to township Disaster Management committees; 5 climate risk information sub-committees formed (1 in each of the 5 project townships); 5 weather or agro bulletins/month produced in each of the 5 project townships; Sustainability Strategy and Exit Plan prepared for all project outputs and project being phased out as per plan.
